author: __flcl
content: Yep it can be customized via genesis spec. But I don't see now why, we don't change any contract but DepositContract. I guess neither hiver nor testnets need such a feature. So looks like not an issue

author: jochembrouwer
content: Yes also notice that for deposit contract, this was deployed "normally". For the system contracts, there was a synthetic address generated (no one has the pkey) and a specific chain-agnostic tx which would deploy the contract at a specific address (part of EIP). So deposit address is likely to change. I haven't checked but likely the deposit transaction is likely only possible on chainid=1. So on other chains, if it is not predeployed at the same address, it must be deployed at a different address. So the system contract addresses are part of the EIP spec (although its obv. fine to configure this also ðŸ™‚ )
